results.title: Food from the sun
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses demonstrations and animated drawings to show how all life on earth relies on the sun for energy. Explains the process of photosynthesis. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Basic Film Terms

group_works.title: A Visual dictionary
group_works.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films

results.title: A Visual dictionary
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Film Terms”.
Illustrates basic filmmaking language as it is used in the writing, shooting, and editing of a motion picture. Defines and demonstrates script terminology, kinds of shots, lenses and their effects, camera angles and movement, sound, and optical effects. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Hacksaws, shears and vice-clamps
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Different types of hacksaws and blades are illustrated, and their correct use is demonstrated, common faults being pointed out. Shears, and the making and use of vice-clamps, are also dealt with.

group_siblings.title: The Care and Use of Slip Gauges

results.title: Taps, dies and reamers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”
The process of drilling and countersinking a hole is demonstrated also the cutting of the thread by means of a set of three taps; lubrication is emphasised, and various kinds of tap wrench are shown. Dies of various kinds, and their uses, are demonstrated, as also are parallel, spiral, tapered, and expanding reamers.

results.title: Nuts and bolts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Explains the thread on a bolt and the thread on a nut, and gives information about a number of different standards, using diagrams and actual examples.

results.title: Measuring and marking
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Measuring instruments are introduced: the engineer’s rule, micrometers, vernier gauge, outside and inside callipers and odd legs. The marking-off table, the scriber, scribing black, V blocks, finding the centre of a round bar, drawing lines parallel to the edge of the table, the dial test indicator, the surface plate, testing the flatness of a surface by means of a coloured marking agent, spring dividers, and the fitter’s square are also demonstrated.
